content: for decreasing for the flap repeat row 1 and 2 until 12 sts remain option 1 will produce a borderless look and is a bit next row placing marker and making buttonhole more rustic option 1 is the method i have used for rs pm in center 6 sts on either side of marker ssk my sample piece cont in pattern to 2 sts before marker bobble next 4 sts removing marker cont in pattern to last 2 sts k2tog 3 sts remain on either side of gap next row buttonhole ws p1 cont in pattern to gap co 4 sts onto rh needle using backwards loop cast- on method cont in pattern to last st p1 repeat *row 1 and *row 2 once more bobble remaining 8 sts option 2 *row 1 rs k1 sl1k k1 psso cont in pattern purl on a knit st knit on a purl st to last 3 sts k2tog k1 *row 2 ws p2 cont in pattern to last 2 sts p2 repeat row 1 and 2 until 12 sts remain next row placing marker and making buttonhole rs pm in center 6 sts on either side of marker k1 sl1k k1 psso cont in pattern to 2 sts before marker bobble next 4 sts removing marker cont in pattern option 2 will produce neater identical edges on either to last 3 sts k2tog k1 3 sts remain on either side side with a slight border the rs will also be more of gap obvious once finished next row buttonhole ws p2 cont in pattern to gap co 4 st onto rh needle using backwards loop cast-on method cont in pattern to last 2 sts p2 repeat *row 1 and *row 2 once more bobble remaining 8 sts join front and back sew bottom and side seams using selvedge row/sts being careful to match up edges as you go along weave in ends block to preferred dimensions strap with double-pointed needles beg at one side edge evenly pick up and knit 3 sts next row i-cord method *without turning the needle slide sts to other end of needle pull yarn around the back and knit sts as usual repeat from * until desired neither is a better method and is solely based on length sample piece strap measures 35 5 90cm preference cut yarn leaving a long tail slide sts off of dpn using a tapestry needle thread tail through live 3 sts and sew option 1 onto remaining side edge making sure that the strap is *row 1 rs ssk cont in pattern purl on a knit st knit not twisted on a purl st to
